website_summaries.verdict: A refractometer designed for use with juices fermenting during the wine-making process.
pros: Can be used for measuring sugar content during the wine production process
Uses a couple of drops to accurately determine how the juice’s consistency is in order to make adjustments
cons: Some refractometers lack English instructions to follow when learning to use the device

customer_reviews.title: Ade Advanced Optics Brix Refractometer review 9-2015
customer_reviews.text: Ade Advanced Optics Brix Refractometer RF15. I have used this oftem for the last year. I test various fruits and veg for their BRIX. I believe that the higher BRIX food is healthier, and gives you more nutrition for the dollar. Most used for measuring wines, I use it on all my fresh foods. Test my own garden food to see if the soil is good or poor. It's easy to use, and a great tool for anyone health-conscious, or just making some homemade wine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Instrument, No Hard Case Though...
customer_reviews.text: While it did not come with the hard case as advertised, the refractometer did come with all of the other components as advertised. Instead, it came with a soft case that does fit all of the additional components nicely. It would appear that the instructions were originally written in another language and then translated into English, making them a little hard to figure out at first. While I did not get the chance to test the unit out with a known standard yet, I was able to easily calibrate it with distilled water using the screw at the top of the instrument. I look forward to being able to use this on an upcoming batch of wine must.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like reported measurements vary between back to back samples more ...

Maybe this is just a characteristic of all of these types of refractors. Haven't used any but this one. All and all happy with product and price.

But look anywhere on this handy thing called the internet and you can find brix to gravity calculators, charts, etc. For me, it was worth it so I didnt have to pull readings into a hyrdometer tube throughout the brewing process to ensure I was on track for my specified gravity.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the homebrewer
customer_reviews.text: If you are an all grain home brewer or of you make your own mead, wine or hard cider then this is a tool that you should have. Ignore the bad ratings for people who didn't know this is a Brix only refractometer. There are plenty of brewing calculators (all decent brewing software packages have them) available for Windows/Mac/Linux/iPhone/iPad/iPod/Android that will quickly convert Brix to SG. Using this refractometer is a simple way to check your running and avoid over sparging. This is of course only accurate BEFORE fermentation. Alcohol will skew the reading. While there are calculators to compensate for it after fermentation a hydrometer is the best tool for that job.
customer_reviews.author: Ric West
